section: Implement a Data Warehouse with Microsoft Fabric
question: What workload is a Fabric Data Warehouse optimized for?
options: OLTP;Analytical queries over structured data;Hosting web APIs;Email campaigns

section: Implement a Data Warehouse with Microsoft Fabric
question: Which features are typical in Fabric Data Warehouses?
options: SQL endpoint;Table indexing;Row-level security;Notebook autosave

section: Implement a Data Warehouse with Microsoft Fabric
question: Which schema design is common in data warehouses?
options: Star schema;Snowflake schema;3NF for OLTP;Mesh of random tables

section: Implement a Data Warehouse with Microsoft Fabric
question: Which operations are typical when loading a warehouse?
options: Truncate and reload;Incremental loads;CDC-based loads;Manual editing of each row

section: Implement a Data Warehouse with Microsoft Fabric
question: Which tools can query a Fabric Data Warehouse?
options: T-SQL;Power BI;Excel with connector;Microsoft Word

section: Implement a Data Warehouse with Microsoft Fabric
question: You need to load a large fact table every night and users must never see partially loaded data. Which pattern should you implement?
options: Directly overwrite the fact table row by row;Truncate and load inside a single transaction;Append rows without any transaction;Delete and reinsert individual rows in a loop

section: Implement a Data Warehouse with Microsoft Fabric
question: You are designing a star schema. Where should relatively static attributes like ProductCategory and Brand be stored?
options: Only in the fact table;In a dimension table referenced by the fact table;In a KQL database;In files in a lakehouse folder

section: Implement a Data Warehouse with Microsoft Fabric
question: A team complains that queries filtering on Date and Customer are slow on a large fact table. Which action is most appropriate?
options: Drop all indexes on the table;Create a clustered index on relevant key columns;Move the table to a lakehouse;Store the table as CSV files

section: Implement a Data Warehouse with Microsoft Fabric
question: You must ensure regional managers only see rows for their assigned region. How should you implement this in a Fabric data warehouse?
options: Create separate copies of the table per region;Filter data in Power BI only;Define row-level security predicates in the warehouse;Store region data in a KQL database

section: Implement a Data Warehouse with Microsoft Fabric
question: New and updated rows for a fact table are identified by a LastModifiedDate column. Which T-SQL construct is best to apply inserts and updates in a single step?
options: Simple INSERT INTO with SELECT;MERGE statement using business key and LastModifiedDate;DELETE followed by full reload;UPDATE without WHERE clause
notas: Which T-SQL construct is best - meaning of this

section: Implement a Data Warehouse with Microsoft Fabric
question: You want to track slowly changing attributes in a Customer dimension so that historical reports reflect previous values. Which design is most appropriate?
options: Overwrite Customer attributes in place;Use a Type 2 slowly changing dimension with surrogate keys;Store old values in a separate CSV file;Ignore historical attribute changes

section: Implement a Data Warehouse with Microsoft Fabric
question: You need to support multiple time zones in analytical queries. Which modeling approach is recommended for dates and times?
options: Store all timestamps as local time only;Store timestamps in UTC and convert in queries;Store times without dates;Use free-text date columns

section: Implement a Data Warehouse with Microsoft Fabric
question: You are designing a grain for a Sales fact table. Which description best defines the fact table grain?
options: One row per product category;One row per day;One row per customer;One row per customer, product, and day

section: Implement a Data Warehouse with Microsoft Fabric
question: Which scenario is most appropriate for using a degenerate dimension?
options: When you need to store unstructured JSON;When a transaction identifier needs to be used for reporting;When you have a very large text description field;When you want to store images

section: Implement a Data Warehouse with Microsoft Fabric
question: You want to reduce data volume in a very large fact table while preserving essential trends. Which technique is most suitable?
options: Delete all rows older than one month;Aggregate historical data to a higher grain in a summary table;Store raw data only in CSV;Disable compression

section: Implement a Data Warehouse with Microsoft Fabric
question: During an incremental load, you must identify which rows to load from the source. Which column is best suited for this purpose?
options: CustomerName;LastModifiedDate;ProductDescription;CalculatedMargin

section: Implement a Data Warehouse with Microsoft Fabric
question: You need to design surrogate keys for dimension tables. Which statement is correct?
options: Surrogate keys should use business keys such as CustomerCode;Surrogate keys are typically integer identities unrelated to business meaning;Surrogate keys must be GUID strings;Dimensions should not use surrogate keys

section: Implement a Data Warehouse with Microsoft Fabric
question: A reporting team needs near-real-time access to a warehouse table but can tolerate a few minutes of delay. Which loading strategy is most appropriate?
options: Single daily batch at midnight;Micro-batches every few minutes;Full reload every hour;Manual ad-hoc inserts by analysts

section: Implement a Data Warehouse with Microsoft Fabric
question: You want to expose warehouse data to Power BI with the lowest latency and without importing data into a dataset. Which connectivity mode is most suitable?
options: Import mode;DirectQuery to the Fabric warehouse;Export to CSV then load;Analyze in Excel only

section: Implement a Data Warehouse with Microsoft Fabric
question: Which operation in a Fabric data warehouse benefits most from properly maintained statistics?
options: File uploads;Ad-hoc T-SQL queries with filters and joins;Notebook markdown rendering;Capacity assignment

section: Implement a Data Warehouse with Microsoft Fabric
question: You plan to partition a large fact table. Which column is usually the best candidate for partitioning?
options: CustomerName;OrderDate;ProductDescription;SalesAmount

section: Implement a Data Warehouse with Microsoft Fabric
question: You need to support both detailed and aggregated reporting. How should you design your model?
options: Store only detailed facts and aggregate at query time;Create aggregate tables for common queries in addition to detailed facts;Use only preaggregated facts and drop detailed data;Use only Excel pivot tables

section: Implement a Data Warehouse with Microsoft Fabric
question: You want to ensure that business logic for calculations such as GrossMargin is centrally managed and reused. Where should you implement this logic first?
options: In multiple Power BI measures only;Directly inside every report query;In a calculated column or view in the warehouse;In manual Excel workbooks

section: Implement a Data Warehouse with Microsoft Fabric
question: You must design a conformed dimension shared between Sales and Inventory fact tables. What is the main benefit?
options: Each fact table must store its own attributes;Reports can join facts consistently using the same dimension;You avoid creating any relationships;You eliminate the need for surrogate keys

section: Implement a Data Warehouse with Microsoft Fabric
question: You want to track when facts were loaded into the warehouse for auditing purposes. Which column is most appropriate to add to the fact table?
options: Business transaction date;LoadDate;CustomerBirthday;TextComment

section: Implement a Data Warehouse with Microsoft Fabric
question: An analyst requests the ability to run what-if scenarios without affecting production data. Which approach is most suitable in a Fabric warehouse?
options: Allow direct updates on fact tables;Create a dedicated sandbox schema or database;Export all tables to CSV;Give admin rights to the analyst

section: Implement a Data Warehouse with Microsoft Fabric
question: You are designing an ETL process from a lakehouse into a warehouse. Which step should typically occur last?
options: Extract raw files from source systems;Transform data into a star schema;Validate business keys and create surrogate keys;Load staging tables and then dimensional/fact tables

section: Implement a Data Warehouse with Microsoft Fabric
question: You must handle late-arriving dimension records when loading facts. Which strategy is commonly used?
options: Reject all late facts;Use a default “Unknown” dimension member and update later;Delete old facts;Store late facts in a text file

section: Implement a Data Warehouse with Microsoft Fabric
question: You want to separate development and production workloads in Fabric while using the same logical model. Which practice is recommended?
options: Use a single workspace for all environments;Create separate workspaces or databases for dev and prod;Mix dev and prod tables in one schema;Allow developers to update prod tables directly

section: Implement a Data Warehouse with Microsoft Fabric
question: You need to minimize the impact of ETL failures on reporting. Which approach is most appropriate?
options: Load data directly into reporting tables without staging;Use staging tables and swap into reporting tables only after successful loads;Allow partial loads into reporting tables;Disable error handling in pipelines
second_question: What is the main benefit of using staging tables?
second_options: Minimize impact of failures;Allow partial loads;Disable error handling;Improve load speed
second_explanation: Staging tables allow data validation before loading into reporting tables
